info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 28 at 4:52PM CDT until August 28 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT FOR SOUTHERN KANE COUNTY... At 452 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Elburn to near Geneva to near North Aurora, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Aurora and Campton Hills around 455 PM CDT. Geneva and North Aurora around 500 PM CDT. St. Charles, West Chicago, Batavia, Wayne and Valley View around 505 PM CDT. Bartlett and South Elgin around 510 PM CDT. Elgin and East Dundee around 515 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Kaneville, Big Rock and Virgil. This includes... Elgin Community College, Fermilab, IL Math and Science Academy, Kane County Cougars Ballpark, and Waubonsee Community College. Including the following interstates... I-88 between mile markers 104 and 120. I-90 between mile markers 55 and 56. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
